div.l: And doun̄ he goth and cride harowe y die
Thise Clerkis beten̄ hym̄ well and letyn̄ hym̄ lye
And araied hem̄ and toke here hors anon̄
And eke here male and on̄ there wey they gon̄
And atte the Mille dore yit they toke here Cake
Of half a busshell floure full well y bake
¶ Thus was this proude Millere well y bete
And hath loste the gryndyng of his whete
And paide for the sopere eủery dele
For Aleyn̄ and Iohn that betyn̄ hym̄ wele
His wif was y swyvid and his doughtᵘur als
Lo suche it is a Mellere to be fals
And therfore this proverbe is seide full sothe
He darnot wene welle that evill dothe
A Gayloure shall hym̄ self begiled be
And god that sit high in magiste
Save alle thise companye grete and smale
Thus haue y quyt the Millers tale
Explicit fabula pᵒropositi
Incipit prologus Coci london̄
The Coke of london̄ whils the Reve spake
For ioy hym̄ thought he clawed hym̄ on̄ his bakke
A · ha · quod he for Cristis passion̄
This Millere hath a sharpe conclusion̄
Vppon̄ his Argument of his herbergage
Well seide Salamon̄ in his langage
Ne brynge not eủery man̄ to thyn̄ house
For herborough by nyght is ꝑperilouse
Well oughte a man̄ a vised for to be
Whom̄ that he bryngeth vnto his privete
I pray to god so yeve me sorowe and care
Yif eủere sith y hight hoigge of ware
Herd y of a Millere bet sette a werke
He had a Iape of malice in the derke
But god forbede that we stynte here
And therfore yif ye vouchsaf to here
A tale of me that am̄ a poure man̄
I woll tell you as well aseaseas eủer y can̄
